description: From Middle English *unendly, equivalent to un- +â€Ž endly. Cognate with German unendlich.

adjectives.description: unendly (comparative more unendly, superlative most unendly)

entries.meaning: (rare) Having no end; infinite; endless; unending.

adverbs.description: unendly (comparative more unendly, superlative most unendly)

entries.meaning: In an unendly or infinite manner; infinitely; unendingly.
examples: We first underline that despite relevant Godunov type methods actually enjoy several stability properties, their corresponding numerical rate of entropy dissipation stays always smaller than the required one in (2) and as a result, the discrepancies with the exact solutions can only unendly amplify with time.
